intro: Hartliella, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous, and often found growing in rocky or arid environments. Hartliella species are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, four-petaled flowers that are often white or yellow in color. They produce small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. The genus includes several species, many of which are adapted to harsh, dry climates.
